bibl.title: El "Receptum Nautarum" y el Papiro Grenf. II 108. Avec résumés en espagnol et en anglais.
bibl.note: It cannot be ruled out that a document such as P. Grenf. II, 108 refers not to the conclusion of the receptum nautarum, but to a receipt given by a docker to the ship operator, to certify his correct compliance with the "received-for-shipment" business or, at least, with the corresponding locatio conductio.
bibl.seg: Carjaval Patricio-Ignacio, El "Receptum Nautarum" y el Papiro Grenf. II 108. Avec résumés en espagnol et en anglais.
Revista de Estudios Históricos-Juridicos [Valparaíso] 28 (2006) pp. 145-155. [Accessible en ligne, en téléchargement gratuit: < http://www.scielo.cl/scielo.php?script=sci_serial&pid=0716-5455 >.]

It cannot be ruled out that a document such as P. Grenf. II, 108 refers not to the conclusion of the receptum nautarum, but to a receipt given by a docker to the ship operator, to certify his correct compliance with the "received-for-shipment" business or, at least, with the corresponding locatio conductio.
